Tc.name: Tc

Tc.Sandbox.name: Tc.Sandbox
Tc.Sandbox.author: Remo Brunschwiler

getModuleById.description: Gets the appropriate module for the given ID.

readyForAfterBinding.description:
Collects the module status messages and handles the callbacks.
This means that it is ready for afterBinding.

return.description: A list containing the references of the registered modules.

addModules.description: Adds (register and start) all modules in the given context scope.

params.name: type
params.description: The dependency type (plugin | library | util | url)

params.name: callback
params.description:
The callback to execute after the dependency has successfully
loaded.

params.name: phase
params.description:
The module phase where the dependency is needed
(e.g. beforeBinding, onBinding).

loadDependency.description: Loads a requested dependency (if not already loaded).

params.name: modules
params.description: A list containting the module instances to remove.

removeModules.description:
Removes a module by module instances.
This stops and unregisters a module through a module instance.

firstScript.description: Contains the first script node on the page.

Tc.Sandbox.description:
The sandbox function
The sandbox is used as a central point to get resources from, grant
permissions, etc.  It is shared between all modules.

Tc.Connector.name: Tc.Connector
Tc.Connector.author: Remo Brunschwiler

params.name: role
params.description: The role of the module (e.g. master, slave etc.)

return.description: Indicates whether the default action should be excuted or not

params.name: component
params.description: The module that sends the state change

params.name: data
params.description: Contains the state relevant data (if any)

params.name: callback
params.description:
The callback function, it can be executed after an asynchronous
action.

notify.description:
Notifies all registered components about a state change 
This can be be overriden in the specific connectors.

proceed.description:
Gives the components the ability to prevent the default- and
afteraction from the events by returning false in the
on<Event>-Handler.

Tc.Connector.description: Base class for the different connectors.

Tc.Config.name: Tc.Config
Tc.Config.author: Remo Brunschwiler

dependencyPath.description: The paths for the different types of dependencies.

Tc.Config.description:
Contains the application base config.
The base config can be extended or overwritten either via
new Application ($ctx, config), during bootstrapping the application or via 
/public/js/Tc.Config.js in the project folder.

Tc.Utils.String.name: Tc.Utils.String
Tc.Utils.String.author: Remo Brunschwiler

capitalize.description: Capitalizes the first letter of the given string.

Tc.Utils.String.description: Contains utility functions for string concerning tasks.

Tc.Module.name: Tc.Module
Tc.Module.author: Remo Brunschwiler

getDecoratedModule.description: Decorates itself with the given skin.

params.name: data
params.description: The data to provide to your connected modules

fire.description: Notifies all attached connectors about changes.

params.name: type
params.description: The dependency type (library | plugin | util | url)

params.name: phase
params.description:
The module phase where the dependency is needed
(e.g. beforeBinding, onBinding)

params.name: executeCallback
params.description:
Indicates whether the phase callback should be executed or not.
This is useful for dependencies that provide their own callback
mechanism.

stop.description: Template method to stop the module.

beforeBindingCallback.description: Callback for the before binding phase.

start.description:
Template method to start (i.e. init) the module.
This method provides some hook functions which could be overridden
from the concrete implementation.

params.name: sandbox
params.description: The sandbox to get the resources from

params.name: callback
params.description: The callback to execute if all dependencies were loaded

checkDependencies.description:
Checks the dependency load state of the given phase.
Initializes the appropriate phase if all dependencies are loaded.

sandbox.description: The sandbox to get the resources from.

onBinding.description:
The following counters have to be at least zero, so that
the onBinding callback is loaded as a dependency for
onBinding and the onBinding phase is completed for 
afterBinding.

dependencyCounter.description: Contains the dependency counter for the different phases.

Tc.Module.description: Base class for the different modules.

Tc.Application.name: Tc.Application
Tc.Application.author: Remo Brunschwiler

return.description: The reference to the registered module.

params.name: modName
params.description:
The module name. It must match the class name of the module
(case sensitive).

params.name: skins
params.description:
A list of skin names. Each entry must match a class name of a
skin (case sensitive).

params.name: connectors
params.description:
A list of connectors identifiers (e.g. MasterSlave1Master).
Schema: <connectorName><connectorId><connectorRole>

params.name: modules
params.description: A list containting the module instances to unregister

unregisterModule.description: Unregisters the modules given by the module instances.

params.name: modules
params.description: A list containting the module instances to stop.

params.name: modules
params.description: A list of the modules to start

registerConnection.description: Registers a connection between a module and a connector.

return.description: A list containing the references of the registered modules.

registerModules.description:
Register modules withing scope
Automatically registers all modules within the scope, 
as long as the modules use the OOCSS naming conventions.

modules.description:
Contains references to all modules on the page.
Could be useful for example when there are interactions between
Flash <-> JS.

sandbox.description:
The sandbox to get the resources from 
This sandbox is shared between all modules.

connectors.description: Contains references to all connectors on the page.

classes.description:
A module can have three types of classes:
- .mod 
Indicates that it is a base module (default 
-> no javascript need to be involved). Must occur
excactly once.
- .mod<moduleName> (e.g. .modBasic) 
Indicates that it is a module of type basic, which is
derived from the base module. It can occur at most
once.
- .skin<moduleName><skinName> (e.g. .skinBasicSubmarine) 
Indicates that the module basic has the submarine skin.
It will be decorated by the skin js (if existing). It
can occur arbitrarily.
Additionally, a module can have one type of data attributes:
- data-connectors
A comma-separated value containing the connector ids,
the schema of a connector id is: 
<connectorName><connectorId><connectorRole>
e.g. MasterSlave1Master:
name = MasterSlave, id = 1, role = Master
The above indicates that the module should notify the
MasterSlave connector (the mediator) over all state
changes. The connector id is used to chain the
appropriate modules together and to improve the
reusability of the connector.
It can contain multiple connector ids (e.g.
1,2,MasterSlave1Master)
TODO: Is this still correct? The above statement referenced
type 1 for data-connectors

wildcardComponents.description: Contains references to all wildcard components on the page.

Tc.Application.description: Responsible for application-wide issues such as the creation of modules.
